    • Method Detail

      • getPeriod

        public Period getPeriod()
        Returns the base period. Base period is used as the starting point for price aggregation (range, renko, point and figure) and tick bar aggregation feeds. Valid base periods are 1, 2,...7 days. The base period is verified according to FeedDescriptor's DataType at data loading time, so if the period is not valid an IllegalArgumentException is thrown at the data loading time.

        For price aggregation data types and tick bars (TICK_BAR, PRICE_RANGE_AGGREGATION, POINT_AND_FIGURE, RENKO) base period must be with the Unit.Day and the number of units must be 1 <= numOfUnits <= 7. Base period shift must be in full hours and must be in a range of [TimeUnit.HOURS.toMillis(-12),TimeUnit.HOURS.toMillis(12)].

        If the base period is 7 days, the starting point is considered to be Monday 00:00:00.000 UTC and the ending point is Sunday 23:59:59.999. Otherwise the starting point's day is based on the days passed since 1970.01.01. Period has a parameter 'shift' in milliseconds, which shifts the starting point of base period. E.g., base period 7 days with shift TimeUnit.HOURS.toMillis(-3) starts the bar calculation at Sunday 21:00:00.000 UTC.

        Specified by:
        getPeriod in interface IFeedDescriptor
        Overrides:
        getPeriod in class FeedDescriptor
        Returns:
        period - base period

      • setPeriod

        public void setPeriod(Period basePeriod)
        Sets the base period. Base period is used as the starting point for price aggregation (range, renko, point and figure) and tick bar aggregation feeds. Valid base periods are 1, 2,...7 days. The base period is verified according to FeedDescriptor's DataType at data loading time, so if the period is not valid an IllegalArgumentException is thrown at the data loading time.

        For price aggregation data types and tick bars (TICK_BAR, PRICE_RANGE_AGGREGATION, POINT_AND_FIGURE, RENKO) base period must be with the Unit.Day and the number of units must be 1 <= numOfUnits <= 7. Base period shift must be in full hours and must be in a range of [TimeUnit.HOURS.toMillis(-12),TimeUnit.HOURS.toMillis(12)].

        If the base period is 7 days, the starting point is considered to be Monday 00:00:00.000 UTC and the ending point is Sunday 23:59:59.999. Otherwise the starting point's day is based on the days passed since 1970.01.01. Period has a parameter 'shift' in milliseconds, which shifts the starting point of base period. E.g., base period 7 days with shift TimeUnit.HOURS.toMillis(-3) starts the bar calculation at Sunday 21:00:00.000 UTC.
